text: Bob Woodward (born March 26, 1943) is an American author and journalist who began working for The Washington Post around 1971. He was born in Chicago, Illinois."Bob Woodward". The Washington Post. Retrieved September 4, 2018. He is known for his reporting with Carl Bernstein on the Watergate Scandal which eventually led to President Richard Nixon's resignation in 1974. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:American political writers
title: Bob Woodward
